main_definition: Mass refers to the amount of matter in an object or a collection of objects, often associated with weight but distinct as it is not dependent on gravity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical quantity representing the mass of an object
meanings_and_examples.example: The Earth has a mass of approximately 5.972 × 10^24 kilograms.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large number or amount in general
meanings_and_examples.example: There are millions of stars within our galaxy, known as the Milky Way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a biological context, referring to body weight without specifying height or density
meanings_and_examples.example: During his annual check-up, John's doctor expressed concern over his mass gain since last year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An event involving large numbers of people with common interests
meanings_and_examples.example: The music festival attracted hundreds of thousands in its 'mass' attendance this summer.
